headline: Fund launched to protect Guyana's forests  in pictures
text: An aerial view of Iwokrama rainforest reserve in Guyana Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       The majestic Kaieteur Falls over Potaro River creates stunning landscape views of the rainforest Photograph: John Martin/Conservation International       A boy from Yupukari village, home to Macushi people, jumps across shallow waters in the river Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       A giant anteater (Myrmecophaga tridactyla) strolls in the tall grass of Karanambu Lodge in Rupununi area of Guyana Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       A giant Amazon water lily (Victoria amazonica), the largest lily in the world, floats in the permanent freshwater ponds of Rupununi savannah Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       A giant leaf frog (Phyllomedusa bicolor) in the Iwokrama rainforest reserve Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       A Macushi boy plays with a giant otter (Pteronura brasiliensis) Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International       The Macushi people living in Iwokrama reserve weave split cane to make artefacts and other household objects Photograph: Pete Oxford/iLCP/Conservation International
